title: Theta (Time Decay Patterns)
badge_description: You understand time decay and how to make it your ally instead of your enemy

screens.headline: Why do 90% of options expire worthless?
screens.text: THETA. Every single day, your options lose value - even if you're right about direction. Time decay is the silent killer. Learn to make it your weapon instead of your enemy.

screens.headline: Theta: The Time Decay Tax
screens.text: Theta measures how much your option loses in value per day. It's ALWAYS negative for option buyers (you lose money daily) and ALWAYS positive for option sellers (you make money daily). Theta accelerates exponentially as expiration approaches.

screens.headline: Theta is a Melting Ice Cube
screens.text: Your option is an ice cube on a hot day. At first it melts slowly (90 days out). Then faster (30 days). By the final week, it's melting in your hand (exponential decay). You can't stop it - only choose whether you're buying or selling the ice.

cards.definition: NON-LINEAR decay - accelerates as expiration nears
Markets closed Sat/Sun but theta keeps decaying
cards.example: Buy Friday = lose 3 days of value by Monday

cards.definition: 30-45 DTE = maximum theta decay without too much gamma risk
cards.example: Most pros sell options 30-45 days out and close at 50% profit

screens.question: Your call has theta of -$0.15. What does this mean?
options: You lose $0.15 per day ($15 per contract per day)
screens.explanation_correct: Perfect! Theta -$0.15 means you lose $0.15 per share per day. × 100 shares = $15 per contract per day. This is your 'rent' for holding the option.
screens.explanation_wrong: Theta is DAILY decay. -$0.15 means $0.15 per share lost each day. Multiply by 100 shares per contract = $15/day rental cost.

screens.question: Which position BENEFITS from theta decay?
screens.explanation_correct: Exactly! Option SELLERS have positive theta - they collect money every day as options decay. This is why covered calls and cash-secured puts can be profitable even if the stock doesn't move.
screens.explanation_wrong: Think about it: If you SOLD an option for $5 and it decays to $3, you can buy it back cheaper (profit). Sellers LOVE theta decay!

screens.question: You buy a $5 call on Monday (30 DTE). Stock doesn't move all week. Friday it's worth $4.50. What happened?
screens.explanation_correct: Exactly! Stock didn't move, but TIME passed. 5 days × ~$0.10/day theta = $0.50 loss. This is why buying options and 'hoping' is a losing strategy - you're fighting theta every day.
screens.explanation_wrong: Stock flat = no delta impact. What changed? TIME. You lost ~$0.10/day × 5 days = $0.50 to theta decay. Time is not your friend when you're long options.
